Title: The Inner Light
QuoteText: Seize the time, Meribor. Live now. Make now always the most precious time. Now will never come again.
Live Long and Prosper

Title: Star Trek II: The Wrath of Khan
QuoteText: Khaaannnn!

Title: The Best of Both Worlds, Part 1
QuoteText: Resistance Is Futile

Title: The Best of Both Worlds: Part II
QuoteText: Oh... Then let me just say that... our relationship is beyond friendship, beyond family. And I will let him go. And you must do the same. There can only be one Captain.

Title: The Best of Both Worlds: Part II
QuoteText: I successfully planted a command into the Borg collective consciousness. It misdirected them to believe it was time to regenerate. In effect, I put them all to sleep.

Title: The Best of Both Worlds: Part II
QuoteText: Then take your best shot, Locutus, 'cause we are about to intervene.
Fun will now commence.
As appealing as that sounds, I'm a doctor, not a dragonslayer.

When I think about everything we've been through together, maybe it's not the destination that matters, maybe it's the journey, and if that journey takes a little longer, so we can do something we all believe in, I can't think of any place I'd rather be or any people I'd rather be with.
Well, let me guess! You're either lost, or desperately searching for a good tailor.
I have my eye on you, Quark.

Title: Star Trek IV: The Voyage Home
QuoteText: Admiral, there be whales here!

Character: The Doctor, Missy, and River Song
QuoteText: Without hope, without witness, without reward.
This is what he believes, and this is the reason above all, I love him. My husband. My madman in a box. My Doctor.

Title: Blink
QuoteText: People assume that time is a strict progression of cause to effect, but actually from a non-linear, non-subjective viewpoint - it's more like a big ball of wibbly wobbly... time-y wimey... stuff.

Title: Blink
QuoteText: "The angels have the phonebox," that's my favourite, I've got that on a T-shirt

Title: Blink
QuoteText: Gotta dash. Things happening. Well, four things. Well, four things and a lizard.

Title: Blink
QuoteText: It was raining when we met.

Title: Blink
QuoteText: It's the same rain.

Title: Blink
QuoteText: Don't blink. Don't even blink. Blink and you're dead. They are fast. Faster than you can believe. Don't turn your back, don't look away, and DON'T blink.

Title: The Eleventh Hour
QuoteText: I am definitely a madman with a box!

Title: The Eleventh Hour
QuoteText: Hello. I'm The Doctor. Basically... run.

Title: The Eleventh Hour
QuoteText: Course you're not, you're not scared of anything! Box falls out of the sky, man falls out of a box, man eats fish custard! And look at you... just sitting there. So you know what I think? [Amy: What?]  Must be a hell of a scary crack in your wall.

Title: And the City of Light
QuoteText: I just think that if a super intelligent powerful alien race arrives, we should be prepared.

Title: And the City of Light
QuoteText: You're planning on selling out the human race, aren't you?

Title: And the City of Light
QuoteText: I will absolutely sell out the human race to our new alien ovelords. Don't fight them, they know what's best for us.
Sneaking around? Withholding? I mean, that's something Flynn would do
Our whole *job* is a scavenger hunt!
I'm sure you'll do a great job taking care of the Loch Ness monster!
And no one will accidentally open up Pandora's box!
How many Librarians does it take to get Jenkins out of the box?!

Title: And the Curse of Cindy
QuoteText: Our glorious Cindy awaits your adoration.
Library has the complete collection of lost classics of human civilization, panoply of literature, and you read The Inquisitor.
I love you more than learning itself.
I have a far simpler plan, and a much more convincing British accent.

So, if we borrow the staff, bring it back to the present, use it to defeat Prospero, and then break it without anyone knowing, we didn't violate any of the rules of Schrodinger's Cat. [Flynn:  No. He's upstairs in the Theoretical Animals Wing. ]
Of course, it's the Time Machine Room. The Library has to have a Time Machine Room!
Have you all lost your minds, or have I?!
"Crazy"? So, on a scale of "running from minotaurs" to "Santa Claus is now a best mate of ours," where would a time loop fall?
Librarians. We're the Librarians.
Magic's real.
Architecture is just art we live in. Why doesn't anybody get that?
Magic is not an exact science. If it were, it would be science.
Well, my Urdu's a little rusty.

Because I'm a genius, pop. I'm a genius. I speak nine different languages, and I can read over a dozen more! I have honorary degrees at universities on four different continents! I'm the first one they call when they discover a new piece of art, and I'm the one they're scared to call, because I'm the best in the world at discovering a fake! And I didn't tell you, because I knew that you'd see anything less than chasing the family business as a betrayal!
You people... DON'T APPRECIATE ART!
Oh. Oh, okay. The sea otter is generally adorable, but it is in fact, history's greatest monster. And if we don't take action immediately, they will take over the planet and destroy us all.
Mathemagics. I like it.

Title: The Librarian: Quest for the Spear
QuoteText: The things that make life worth living can't be thought here [in the mind], they must be felt here [in the heart]

Title: And the Curse of Cindy
QuoteText: It's not about who or how many people love you, it's about who you love.

Title: And the Trial of the One
QuoteText: I may have been immortal, but you brought me to life.

Title: And the Infernal Contract
QuoteText: You can do more than you think you can
